fields.description:
Some of the activity date in Pull request shows differently when we hover the dates:

!2623332881-timestamp.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pull Request timestamps are different when hover over the date. (BB-16070)

fields.description: Build status is not updating for completed jobs, even though AWS shows them as complete.
fields.summary: Codedeploy status not updating after successful job. (BB-15984)

fields.description:
When I sign in to a third-party website using Bitbucket, it seems to forget the final redirect destination now that I have 2-Factor-Authentication turned on. Instead of ending up back at the third-party website, I end up in Bitbucket.

I've tested this in incognito/private mode in both Chrome and Firefox, and the results are consistently the same.

If I go to a specific URL (such as "https://bitbucket.org/my-account/my-repo") when not logged in, enter my login credentials, but enter the wrong 2FA code first, even if I then on the 2nd try enter the right 2FA code, I simply get redirected to "https://bitbucket.org/", not the page I was trying to reach.

If I do all that but enter the correct 2FA code on the first try, then it successfully redirects me to the page I was trying to reach.

Given that, it seems that the original redirect target is being lost if the user enters an incorrect 2FA code.
fields.summary: Bitbucket is not redirecting correctly when the user has 2FA enabled (BB-16084)

fields.description:
I want to open my projects to my business partner, but not all over the world, and I don't want to add partner's email into my project, because that will be weird to ask for partner company's engineers' email.\\
Is that possible make my repo only accessed by people who get the url address?\\
Many Thanks!\\
Jay
fields.summary: Is that possible make my repo only accessed by people who get the url address?

fields.description:
Hi,

In 'Branch management' I have configured to restrict pushes for all branches named "_release_".

However a colleague created one that contains "Release" with an upper case letter in it.

I have not seen that it is possible to have case insensitive matching.\\
I do not want to create rules for all possible case combinations.

Can we enable case insensitive matching (perhaps by default) on the branch names?

Regards,\\
David.
fields.summary: Branch management, case insensitive branch matching.

fields.description:
I am getting this error while trying to push my files from local repository to the cloud.

POST git-receive-pack (86474873 bytes)

i have tried the below and tried pushing again, but nothing helps.

git config http.sslVerify false

git config http.postBuffer 524288000
fields.summary: Can't push for the first time

fields.description:
###Summary\\
Unable to use *Sync Branch* function on UI.

###Environment\\
Chrome  (49.0.2623.112)\\
Firefox (44.0.2)\\
Internet Explorer 11 (11.162.10586)\\
Microsoft Edge (25.10586)

###Steps to Reproduce

# Go to the *Repository*
# Click *Branches* on the left side bar
# Click *Merged*
# Hover to right side of the branch
# Click the *More* icon
# Click *Sync branch*

!3803947243-BugReport%20Sync%20Branch.gif|thumbnail!

###Expected Results\\
Sync Branch windows will pop up to allow the user to enter the commit message and sync the branch.

###Actual Results\\
Sync Branch windows doesn't show.

###Workaround\\
The workaround is to refresh the *Branches>Merged* page

!3455832941-BugReport%20Sync%20Branch%20WorkAround.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to use Sync Branch on UI (Branches>Merged)

fields.description: Some users may want to prevent direct pushes to master to ensure all code has to be reviewed before going in with a pull request; but after the review, any member of the team is able to merge the request regardless of being prevented from direct pushes.
fields.summary: Enhancement request: Allow user to merge pull requests, even if the user is prevented to push to the specific branch related to the pull request.

fields.description:
When reviewing pull requests, there is an "Overview" tab that shows the full diff and allows adding comments to particular changed lines. Through out the review process multiple fixes can emerge and trying to keep our history clean we rewrite our PR commits. Luckily Bitbucket can handle that and outdated comments can be still found (and Activity tab is a life saver).\\
But we would like Bitbucket even more friendly in that regard. Some PRs get really big and include multiple commits. It is really hard to keep context of all changes while doing review and it is easier to review commit by commit. The PR page has a "Commits" tab showing all commits. When you click on particular commit, you can see the diff and put comments there. The problem is that those comments are not considered to be part of PR and do not show up in Activities tab. If/when PR commits are rewritten to accommodate latests fixes based on other comments, all comments made to particular commit are lost and it is VERY hard to find them.

It would be nice if when you open commits from PR, they keep track that we are reviewing them as part of PR and thus all comments made there are considered part of PR (thus show up in Activities tab). You could have a special URL to view commit inside PR, e.g. /pull-requests/<PR_id>/<branch_name>/commits/<commit_id> in addition to usual commit URL /commits/<commit_id>.

Even if you do not rewrite Git history it would still be beneficial to see all comments to all commits under Activities tab.
fields.summary: Reviewing pull requests on a per-commit basis (BB-15978)

fields.description:
At present, it is possible to have email sent to an email address, which may in turn be a mailing list.  This provides a method for team members and interested parties to follow commits.  However, if a team member adds a comment to a commit.  I haven't confirmed this, but it may also be that someone watching the commit will receive notice of the comment and/or someone watching the repo. may also see this comment.  Watching a specific commit is an unlikely action, and watching an entire repo. is both overkill in our case (because we have a mailing list set up) and notices won't be seen by team members who happen not to have a bitbucket user-id.

Suggestion: provide a method for either having commit comments sent to the mailing list associated with commits and/or a separate mailing list for tracking comments on commits only.
fields.summary: RFE: Provide method for sending commit comments to an email list (BB-15974)

fields.description:
Hi,

/pullrequests/XXX/comments seams to return different sets of pull request comments for the v1 and v2 API. I noticed that v1 marks certain comments as spam (attribute is_spam) while v2 doesn't return that field anymore and also ignores (=not returns) issues that v1 marks as spam! Is that intended behavior? Also, on what is the spam classification based on?

This means that the Bitbucket UI shows all the comments v1 returns (even the ones classified as spam) while v2 doesn't return all comments shown in the UI!

Best regards,\\
Michael
fields.summary: Amount of pull request comments returned differ in v1 and v2 of the API

fields.description: Picture here: https://bitbucket.org/hudson/magic-lantern/issues/2467/old-prs-keep-popping-up-as-updated
fields.summary: Old PRs reappear as updated

fields.description:
While creating a pull-request through commandline, I want to add 'default' reviewers for a branch. I want to know if Bitbucket has already assigned default reviewers for a branch? If this feature is available, I would be able to use the same script for every branch in different repositories.

For instance:\\
The default reviewers could be members of all the branches connected with the master except the one making the pull request.
fields.summary: Default Reviewers for a branch creating Pull-Request
Unnecessary and unkind associates that may be known to you

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

# Open the "Branches" page.
# Try to delete an active branch. (Successfully opens.)
# Cancel.
# Change to the "Merged" filter.
# Try to delete a merged branch. (Fails to open.)
# Cancel.
# Reload the page.
# Try to delete a merged branch. (Successfully opens.)
# Cancel.
# Change to the "Active" filter.
# Try to delete an active branch. (Fails to open.)
fields.summary: Unable to delete branches on 'Branches' page after first changing the filter (BB-15972)

fields.description:
I'm not 100% sure it's the spaces, but I'm not sure what else it could be.

for example, I click on a file named "API - Javascript.md" - the end of the URL now looks like this: pull-requests/106/diff#docs/API - Javascript.md however in the right panel, the contents for a DIFFERENT file - app/config/api.yml - is shown. I don't know if it's matching the string before the space "API" -> "api"? or if it's just that app/config/api.yml happens to be the first file listed in this diff.

I've tried reloading the page, clicking on this in various ways, etc, but the diff for the "API - Javascript.md" file refuses to load.

I remember I've had this issue before, but I forget what the name of the file was. I figured it was just a fluke, or something odd about that PR. but seeing it happen again, I have to wonder if there's an actual bug with the diff viewer.
fields.summary: web PR diff viewer fails to show contents of files with spaces in the name?
Git blame view should enable the option to ignore white space changes

fields.description:
Since about the 22nd of March the diff emails contain an HTML part that seems to be generated by interpreting the diff as markdown. Unsurprisingly the results of this are more comedic than useful, especially if you use a mailer that doesn't allow viewing the text part instead of the HTML part (like the gmail web interface).

Since the mails are almost useless like this it would be great if this could be fixed.
fields.summary: Diff emails are mangled

fields.description:
Currnetly to hear about any changes to the master branch, you need to either trust that all of your colleagues will always use pull requests to modify master, or sign up for notifications of any commit to any branch.

This gets redundant when you get notified about commits to a branch, and then later again when that branch is merged to master through a pull request.

This problem would be solved with per-branch notifications, where you could watch branches like "master" (in case someone modifies it without a pull request), or "staging" and "development", which typically don't necessarily get modified with pull requests.
fields.summary: Add per-branch notifications for "Repository Watching: All commits"

fields.description:
Here where I work we use pull requests to making code reviews and Jira tickets to track the found code issues and to get metrics later. The problem is that currently we don't have a way to reference a specific comment added to bitbucket commit inside Jira

I think this improvement would be like Jira's comments, where you can click on the chain icon and get a permalink to that specific comment:\\
!2511867306-jira-comment-permalink.png|thumbnail!

Is it possible to do?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create 'permalinks' to comments in commit view

fields.description:
First of all,  I don't know if it's actually an issue or not. I just found and thought to report here.

I have an access to the private repository on bitbucket and I wanted it to clone it via terminal (without authenticate first then clone. i.e., sending username:password in url) .

so i tried with something like this:

{code}
git clone https://username:passwordText@bitbucket.org/repoOwner/repoName.git
{code}

output:

{code}
Cloning into 'repoName'...
fatal: unable to access 'https://username:passwordText@bitbucket.org/repoOwner/repoName.git/': Could not resolve host: ml@bitbucket.org
{code}

Now the problem is that i have passwordText contains {{@}}. In that case it's takes\\
{{ml@bitbucket.org}} as a part of host.

I encoded @ (hex value) - By replacing {{@}} with {{%40}} in passwordText only, it seems to be work fine..

I want to know why is this so.? Isn't it needs to encode it by itself?

Thanks!

Cheers,

Narain S.
fields.summary: Could not resolve host: sometext@bitbucket.org while cloning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a Pull Request page, there are 3 tabs, Overview, Commits and Activity

Users can center-click the title of any of them, in order to open a new Pull Request page with the respective tab open

When in Chrome or Safari, this action hides some info from the Overview tab

This works ok with Firefox and Internet Explorer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a repo with a PR on the website, either in Chrome or Safari
# Open one of the PRs on this repo
# Center-click the Activity tab (in order to open this in a new browser page)

h3. Expected Results
The PR opens in a new browser page, with the Activity tab of the PR open

The current page continues to show the Overview tab of the PR:

!1049474128-Screen%20Shot%202016-04-01%20at%2018.56.25.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The PR opens in a new browser page, with the Activity tab of the PR open

The current page is missing some info on the Overview tab, like Author and Comments:

!4151993673-Screen%20Shot%202016-04-01%20at%2018.56.45.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Center-clicking the tabs of a PR page, hides info in Chrome and Safari

fields.description:
When generating a diff, Bitbucket should attempt to detect if files were renamed instead just showing them as removed and then added with a different path.

This issue is for Git diffs; renames in Mercurial diffs is tracked in BCLOUD-12539.
fields.summary: Display renamed/moved files in diffs (Git)

fields.description: For a user that needs to only observe some specific source folders in a repository, instead of the whole repository, this feature will be really useful. Users don't need to be overwhelmed with having notifications for everything that goes on in the repository, but instead be notified about the specific folders that is related to the user's work.
fields.summary: Feature Request: The ability to watch specific source folders in a repository

fields.description:
As said in the Title, currently there are not a way to filter the current commits returned when hit commits endpoint.

Some user histories that i need to get covered (doing it by my self on my endpoint but think\\
that would be a nice addition to the API).

Commits Resource: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/commits-or-commit-resource-389775478.html

User histories:

As a third party consumer i want to get  all commits on a repository   filtered by an author name.\\
-https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repository}/commits?author={author_name}

As a third party consumer i want to get  all commits on a repository  filtered by date starting from {date}:\\
-https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repository}/commits?from={date}

As a third party consumer i want to get  all commits on a repository  filtered by date starting until {date}:\\
-https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repository}/commits?until={date}

As a third party consumer i want to get  all commits on a repository  filtered by date starting from {date} and until {date}:\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repository}/commits?from={date'}&until={date}

As noted above, and Like it is working now most of the api, all the parameters are optional, so eventually, We can can get commits on a private repository filtered by author and date.

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repository}/commits?access_token={access_token}&author={author_username}&from={date}&until={date}

-Parameters names are just examples names.\\
-Author value should be the author username and not the actual returned author value in the actual response.

Additional & Off-topic comments:

-Seems that this feature is even not present on the bitbucket UI, so if codebase is shared somehow it could be reused there to add some nice features! (Quickly view my own commits on a repository or another user commits, etc).\\
-Maybe this is duplicated already but could not find the issue yet.
fields.summary: Ability to add filters to the returned data of the "Commits" Resource

fields.description: Urls that don't have a valid dns record, give an unclear message
fields.summary: Urls that don't exist give unclear "invalid url" error

Now I want to create repository hierarchy in bitbucket project - Test_Project as following :-

Test_Project (Bitbucket project)

* Web (Repository 1)

{code}
   Module1 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 1)
   Module2 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 2)
   Module3 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 3)
{code}
* Mobile (Repository 2)

{code}
  Module1 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 1)
  Module2 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 2)
  Module3 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 3)
{code}
* Archive (Repository 3)

{code}
  Module1 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 1)
  Module2 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 2)
  Module3 (Sub-Repository/Sub-module 3)
{code}
* Project Documents (Repository 4)

And so on..

So that I will add the local projects in respective bitbucket sub repository.

Can anyone please guide how to create the sub-repositories/sub-modules in new repository in bitbucket.

How can I clear this out so it will let me add the key?

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1 Create a repository and a 2nd wiki page (I named it _wikipage2_) other than the default _Home_ page.

2 In _Home_, add an internal embedded link to the _wikipage2_. I did it like this:

{code}
[[wikipage1]]
{code}

3 Notice that in _Home_, the link to _wikipage2_ works.

4 Now, transfer the repository or rename it\\
5 Notice that in _Home_, the link to _wikipage2_ now leads to a 404 - it links back to the older URL.

Workaround - manually edit the links in _Home_

fields.description:

fields.description:
When opening a pull request, there can be dozens or hundreds of files. It would be nice to have a way to track which files have been reviewed (tracking at the level of lines of code might be overkill), for instance by adding a checkbox/slider beside each file.

As we can "approve" individual commits, it would be nice to have the same there.

I am aware of the "Task" feature (which I love), but I cannot create a task for every file when a pull request/commit has 20+ files.

fields.summary: Repo download

fields.description:
h1. Problem:
As a user, when I change the 'url' field in my repositories .gitmodules file to be relative, rather than absolute, the link to the associated submodule within the Bitbucket source view page is no longer active and is replaced by a text representation. Attached screenshots, and here is a diff as an example of the .gitmodules change to stimulate the issue:

{code}
#!diff

[submodule "communis"]
        path = communis
-       url = git@bitbucket.org:kanetoadstudios/communis.git
+       url = ../communis.git
{code}

h1. Suggested solution:
Whatever parses the .gitmodules file, for the purposes of presenting the user with a link to the associated submodule, should be modified to understand relative paths and behave in the same way as it would if the 'url' field was absolute.\\
NOTE: If there is a problem resolving the relative link, the current operation is acceptable, but I don't believe there is a problem in the case I'm reporting as git performs a recursive clone quite happily with the relative url I supplied. See [gitmodules|https://git-scm.com/docs/gitmodules] documentation for info.
fields.summary: git submodule link on Bitbucket sources page doesn't work when url in .gitmodules is relative

Please make sure you have the correct access rights

fields.description:
Lets say I have 2 repositories: "TestRepo" and "TestRepo.Git"

When I try to browse repository 2 I always redirected to repository 1 (even when browse source code).

It seems like if url ends with ".git" it always replaced with "".\\
As a result I have to manually add ".git.git" to every URL that I use.

Test repo: https://bitbucket.org/xferra/testrepo.git.git/src\\
Please try to open txt file.
fields.summary: Unexpected behavior when repository name ends with .git (BB-16132)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Browse an issue list
* Click a column header, such as "Title" anywhere other than the word "Title" itself, e.g. in the large empty space, or on the arrow.
* Nothing happens.

This is not straightforward UX, because there is no visual indicator that clicking on the text itself will do anything differently than clicking anywhere else in the header. For example, if you made the header title underline on mouseover, then it would give a visual cue to the user that "oh, I have to click on the word itself."

In fact, the only mouseover-related visual cue we are given is that an arrow appears when you mouseover _anywhere on the header_, which would seem to indicate that clicking _anywhere on the header_ will do something.

Proposed remedy:

* Allow clicking anywhere in the header to affect the same change as clicking directly on the title of the header.
fields.summary: Click a column header to sort issues list requires annoyingly accurate mouse aim (BB-16051)

fields.description:
I deleted the repository [stefanwimmer/morefood2|https://bitbucket.org/stefanwimmer/morefood2] and set a redirect url.

But I now also deleted the repository I redirected to because I don't need it any more.

But the redirect url still exists, it just redirect to the Error 404 page.
fields.summary: No method to delete redirects of deleted repositories (BB-16079)

fields.description:
When scrolling down the page of a code review, it would be nice if the top section could stick (like https://getbootstrap.com/examples/navbar-fixed-top/ ) so the commit/PR messages and information are visible at all times.

!2953544011-scroll.JPG|thumbnail!

!3508077847-scroll2.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pull request and commit top section to follow along as users scroll down

fields.description:
While exploring the history of one of our projects via the API, I came across one of our earlier pull requests.

This is a request for the commits involved in a (merged) PR:

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/fairfax/coreplatforms-spock/pullrequests/17/commits

...but it yields a 404, with the error message:

{"error": {"message": "The source or destination could not be found."}}

This is consistent with the UI, which also reports no commits, but raises a bunch of questions:

# How did we end up with a merged PR with no commits in it? Did we rebase and destroy all the hashes involved?
# Surely an internal error like this should be a 500, not a 404?
# It looks like the code naively falls back from displaying the commits to generating a list based on the source and destination branches - but those obviously aren't present in a merged PR.
fields.summary: Broken pull requests for API

fields.description:
We have a number of users who are getting confused by the password reset feature. If their Bitbucket account is attached to Atlassian accounts, then the Bitbucket password feature will be useless:

https://bitbucket.org/account/password/reset/

Let's create some sort of warning dialogue after determining the account is attached to Atlassian accounts and tell them to reset their password at:

https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword
fields.summary: Show error for Atlassian account users trying to reset their password through Bitbucket (BB-15911)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment any user with write access to a repo can Decline a Pull Request.\\
A repo admin that wants to control who can Decline a Pull Request currently has no way of doing that.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a repo administrator to restrict which users can Decline Pull Requests in that repo.
fields.summary: As a repo admin, I want to restrict the Pull Requests Decline option to specific users

fields.description: I noticed github has numerous additional webhooks available. I'd love to see some more of these like delete make it into bitbucket.
fields.summary: Additional Webhooks for git.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Team admin goes to a User Group in this team >> More >> Update repository access, and changes the access for 'All repositories that the team owns', then each user from that group (that has notifications enabled) receives as many emails as the number of repositories, notifying them that 'Your access to X repo has changed'.

If a team has 300 repositories, then each change results in 300 emails being sent for every change.

h3. Suggested Solution
For changes in team user group access, send one email that lists all repositories where user access has been changed.
fields.summary: As a team member I want to receive only one email that notifies me of changes in repositories access

fields.description: I created a repository for some files which are managed by LFS, committed the files OK. Then created a second repository (enabled LFS as well) and tried adding the first repository as a subtree of the first and I get an error, it starts creating the folder structure and then produces an error
fields.summary: LFS and Subtrees

fields.description:
Can't seem able to [accept and merge pull request|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/pullrequests-resource-423626332.html#pullrequestsResource-Acceptandmergeapullrequest]. We're using the approve method without any kind of problem but when we try to accept the PR we receive the follow message:

_{"error": {"message": "'list' object has no attribute 'copy'", "id": "337_*****************"}}*

Status Code: _500_

We're using this [wrapper|https://github.com/gentlero/bitbucket-api].
fields.summary: API - Error using end-point accept and merge from pull request

fields.description: Hi, I have an import process that got stuck (https://bitbucket.org/appstud/atb_ios) and says "This repository is currently unavailable." Can you delete it?
fields.summary: This repository is currently unavailable.

fields.description: Sometimes when I open a pull request and I find an issue, I don't want to close the PR yet. It would be nice to have some Work in Progress option / status that will disable the "Merge" button.
fields.summary: "Work in progress" state for pull requests

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Create a new issue on the issue tracker
# On the description field, insert an image file. Make sure the file name has brackets on it ('Screen Shot 2016-03-21 at 5.21.44 PM (1).png' for example)
# Click 'Create issue'
# The image will not render correctly
fields.summary: When attaching an image file into the Issue Tracker's Description box, the image rendering breaks if the filename contains a bracket (BB-15903)

fields.description:
The UI shows SSH/HTTPS link at the top right corner for repositories with at least one commit, but is not showing for a brand new repository:

!3983235213-repositorylink.JPG|thumbnail!

It should show for new repositories as well, because users will see that URL directly for a git operation - such as to perform the first push - without it being hidden.
fields.summary: Enhancement request: A brand new repository to show SSH/HTTPS repository URL at the top right corner

fields.description:
Hi,\\
When I change something about issue without putting comment for it, there is no buttons to edit or delete. However when I add comment while changing something of issue, these buttons come. Furthermore when I use delete button, auto report comment is also deleted.

This shot may be more explanatory.

!4287129240-2016-03-19-114223_313x198_scrot.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue information comments w/o user comment cant be deleted

fields.description:
Found on  https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/import-code-from-an-existing-project-259358821.html

We should omit the -u when pushing the tags for the following:

git push -u origin --tags
fields.summary: Fix documentation for pushing tags (BB-15898)

fields.description: As a user can not revoke write access to a repository whose admin is not using bitbucket any more. I was given repository access but now person is never replying me and i do not want his repository to be shown in my account.
fields.summary: Can not revoke write access to a repository

fields.description: Source page's table column should have labels on top of it - all the other pages such as issues, downloads, commits, pull requests have labels. Else, users won't be sure what does some of the information mean within a non-labelled column.
fields.summary: Enhancement request: Source page's table column should have labels to avoid confusion

fields.description:
Hi, for my team there is currently 1 import processes that got stuck and say "This repository is currently unavailable.".

They are not responding for a few days now.

Can these be cleared/deleted so I can start over?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Stuck on "Repository unavailable "

fields.description: I have some markdown content but it is not rendering properly, at least not everytime, when I refresh it, sometimes it renders properly. Splitting the file in two and both halves render fine.
fields.summary: My ReadMe written in Markdown is not previewing properly (BB-15889)

fields.description: Webhook didn't fire from Bitbucket after a branch is deleted from the Bitbucket UI, however, it is working properly when a branch is deleted with "git push origin :branch-name".
fields.summary: Bitbucket doesn't send a webhook after branch is deleted from UI (BB-15888)

fields.description:
h2. How to reproduce
Really simply: installed this personal addon : https://bitbucket.org/tpettersen/pow-location-3 to your personal account

Then, access a repository which is private *BUT* has public issue tracking: https://bitbucket.org/rodogu/my-sandbox/addon/pow-location-3/repoPage-1557b00d6cfd77c0f9bd27b9dc4ce9f8

You will get an error screen (See below)

Note that the issue tracking is public, and the add-on is meant to be used for issues only (besides, it wouldn't matter the access restriction would be respected).

Note that the problem is only with the web item, i.e. the REST API already allows querying public issue tracking on private repositories without problem.

!3866621885-Error%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket%202016-03-15%2012-23-09.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Personal addon web item fails to load in private repository with public issues (BB-16049)

fields.description:
When a watcher loses read access to a repo, they should lose all watcher status associated with that repo as well (Repo-wide, Pull Requests, Commits, Issues.).

A watcher loses read access through at least two events:

# access is explicitly removed by an admin
# the repo was changed to private
fields.summary: Losing access to a repo still leaves the user as a watcher on that repo. (BB-15883)

fields.description:
h2. Request:
curl --request POST \\
--url https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/owner/slug/hooks \\
--header 'authorization: Basic 123456789' \\
--header 'cache-control: no-cache' \\
--header 'content-type: multipart/form-data; boundary=---011000010111000001101001' \\
--form 'description=Webhook description' \\
--form url=path_to_yrl \\
--form active=true \\
--form events=repo:push

h2. Response:
{"error": {"message": "You cannot access body after reading from request's data stream", "id": "0b76372bbec44767bbeb5b06d80cc256"}}

I simply can't create a webhook via API. I can read webhooks with no problem. At first I was using PHP to call the api and then I move to various POST apps from Chrome store to eliminate mistakes on my part.
fields.summary: Creating webhooks via API fails

fields.description: In team projects I would like the feature of filtering commits by author. It would be helpful for searching previous commits by a particular user. Secondly It will be great for audit purpose to see what has been done by a particular author in the project.
fields.summary: Filter commits by author

fields.description: It'd be great, if bitbucket can support more fonts - similar to Google roboto.
fields.summary: Feature request: Provide alternative font options.

fields.description:
# I have two repositories

That failed importing from gitlab and I now cant access to delete myself.

Can you please remove these repositories to avoid confusion with the rest of my team?
fields.summary: Repositories that need deleting

fields.description:
We use Jira and Bitbucket. It would be nice to be able to specify time spent on code review when reviewer approves the pull request. The time spent should be sent to Jira to all tickets mentioned in pull request's name.

Please advise if this functionality would be possible to implement using Bitbucket plugin mechanism. I understand this is not critical when looking at other tickets.
fields.summary: Ability to add time spent on pull request approval

fields.description:
If you try to install a personal add-on (See [Install Button documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/developing/add-on-install-options.html], into a team account, you get a 500 error.

!2910145063-Add-on%20authorization%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket%202016-03-11%2019-22-16.jpg|thumbnail!

The install dialog should either not show team account, or a better error message should be shown.

h2. How to reproduce
Go to https://pow-location-3.herokuapp.com/ and install into a team repository. You'll get a 500 error :'(
fields.summary: Install button should not allow personal addons into team accounts (BB-16105)
incorrect snippet in 'Install an add-on from your site or application' (BB-16160)

fields.description:
These emails have "view the issue" and "unsubscribe from issue" links which are too close.\\
Sometimes I click unsubscribe instead of view.\\
What is good even in that case, it opens bitbucket page and shows balloon "you are unsubscribed" with undo link. The bad thing that this baloon stays only for 5 seconds.

Suggest 1: keep baloon with undo link forever on this page until reload\\
Suggest 2: Move "unsubscribe" to another corner of email layout, say to right-bottom (and keep "view issue" at left bottom).

p.s. When I entered this text I dediced to attach image. I prepared screenshot and dragged it's file to "Attachment" field of the form. Opps, it didnt got the file to the input field, and instead opened it in browser. Ok, the controls seems to be non-standard. Then I clicked back button and ooops - all form text is lost. Please make standard file control in the form, or keep the form text..
fields.summary: Refactor / redesign issue e-mails (BB-15886)

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a repository stuck creating,

Could this be deleted please?
fields.summary: Repository stuck creating

fields.description: i was unable to login in bitbucket using the username but  can login using the full email address.
fields.summary: Cant login using username  in bitbucket

fields.description: Blame on the source view does now show correctly on Chrome if minimum font size is set more than 12. Scroll down, the left column with the commits continues even after the code has finished on the right column. Also the commit lines do not align correctly.
fields.summary: Blame on Bitbucket is broken on Chrome if minimum font size is set more than 12

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce bug:

* Go to 'Branches' view
* Apply 'Merged' filter
* Click menu on right of branch to be deleted
* Click 'Delete branch'
* No modal confirmation/no delete, but URL has "#close-branch" appended.

Workaround, refresh page, resulting in the Merged filter being loaded on page load

* Click menu on right of branch to be deleted
* Click 'Delete branch'
* Modal confirmation appears
fields.summary: Unable to delete merged branches (BB-16038)

fields.description:
Hello,

Its come to my attention that my repos are now in a default project folder. Is there a way to turn off the project folder settings and opt out of using them?
fields.summary: Removing Project folder

fields.description: If you commit something that includes a line that gets hidden when you deactivate 'ignore whitespaces', it will also hide any comment you  put on that line.
fields.summary: Deactivate 'ignore whitespace' hides comments

fields.description: This could be a handy feature in many scenarios. Discontinued projects and repostories, which aren't showed in (for example) your front page and the issues of them are hidden in your issue overview, but are still able to being looked into.
fields.summary: Discontinue repo's/project's

fields.description:
When I start a number list, and type 1. something <enter>, then 2. something <enter>, then 3. something <enter>, BitBucket changes 3. to 1.

is there a known workaround for this or it just needs to be fixed?
fields.summary: Number lists - 3. changes to 1.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Pull requests list for a repository does not show any indication about which PRs have conflicts. A user that wants to check which ones need conflict resolution, needs to open them one by one. If there is a large number of open Pull Requests, this process can be time consuming.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful to have a column in this list that indicates whether each PR has conflicts or not. This way a user can immediately see which ones need conflict resolution.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see which Pull Requests have conflicts in the Open Pull Requests list of a repo
